title: Git & Version Control Quiz
description: Git commands, branching strategies and version control workflows

questions.question: Which command initializes a new Git repository?
questions.explanation: The 'git init' command initializes a new Git repository in the current directory.

questions.question: What does 'git clone' do?
options: Creates a copy of a repository
questions.explanation: 'git clone' creates a local copy of a remote repository.

questions.question: Git commit saves changes to the remote repository.
questions.explanation: Git commit saves changes to the local repository. To save to remote, you need 'git push'.
